deck: Nicola Mari is an italian illustrator. He has worked for Edifumetto, Acme, and Sergio Bonelli Editore, where illustrates volumes like Nathan Never and Dylan Dog
name: Nicola Mari

deck: Italian artist, has illustrated some Nathan Never issues. He is the twin brother of Dante Bastianoni, comics artist as well
name: Francesco Bastianoni

deck: American creator and artist of self-published comics and author of the King of RPGs.
name: Jason Thompson

deck: Writer mostly known for his work in Spirou magazine and "Le journal de Tintin".
description:
Started his career in 1961, working for Spirou magazine, where he wrote stories for "Le vieux Nick", "Sophie", "La Ribambelle", "Boule et Bill", "Gaston Lagaffe", ...
For "Le journal de Tintin" he worked in "Constant Souci", "Zig et Puce" and "Les As".
He has also worked for other magazines, like "Le rire" and "Hara-Kiri", and participated in two issues of Lucky Luke.
name: Vicq (Antoine Raymond)

deck: This is a creator's page for a person who did pencilling work for Continuity Comics.
name: Iota Subotici

deck: Writer/penciller known for his work in Robin Dubois, Clifton, Leonard, Doggyguard, Lucky Luke and Rantanplan.
description: He started his career as a penciller but later focused on the writting. He has worked for Spirou, Pilote, Achille Talon and other magazines. He created, along with Turk, Archimede, Robin Dubois and Leonard. He has participated in volumes like Clifton, Clorophille, Des villes et de femmes, Digitaline, Sam Griffit, Doggyguard, Rantanplan and Lucky Luke.
name: Bob De Groot

deck: Argentinian Comics Artist. His cartoons where used in the 70's by artist Miki Muster to create 400 short animations, presented in Cannes.
name: Guillermo Mordillo

deck: Writer known for his work in Percevan, Lucky Luke, Rantanplan, Kid Lucky, Coton Kid, Outretombe, Spoon & White and Polstar.
description: After some years as a journalist, he starts his career as a comic book creator in 1980, creating Percevan for Editions Glenat. He meets later Xavier Fauche. Together they write plots for Lucky Luke, Rantanplan and Kid Lucky before creating their own Cotton Kid. He also writes for TV, in Fraggle Rock and Les Tiffous. He is a pioneer in internet comics, Tatsoin and John Eigrutel: le contrat Polstar, both created with his son, penciller Simon Leturgie (aka Slet). He works very closely with his son and Yann. Together, they started Spoon & White and Space Cake and keep working on Polstar, Tatsoin and Tekila.
name: Jean Leturgie

description: He was killed in the 2015 terrorist attack on Charlie Hebdo.
name: Cabu

deck: Paola Barbato is an italian writer, known mainly for her work on Dylan Dog
name: Paola Barbato

deck: Comic book creator, writer and artist.
description:
Born Dwight Dennis Morales Francis in Kingston, Jamaica. Immigrated to the United States in 1965.

Francis was an apprentice to Dick Giordano and worked with Neal Adams at Continuity Studios in New York City.

Francis created several series for Blackthorne Publishing Inc. in the 1990s and has also worked in advertising, film and television.
name: Dennis Francis

deck: Louise VandenBergh Altson Golden Age Comic Artist and Cover Painter who worked for Timely.
name: Louise Alston

deck: One of the most prolific comic book writers of Holland.
description: He started his career creating a science-fiction magazine. In 1952 he joined Marten Toonder Studios and worked in Aram, Kappie, Koning Hollewijn, Panda and Tom Poes. He created a philosophical strip called Student Tijloos, then he moved to Pep Magazine and created De Argonautjes, Ambrosius, Blook, Iris, and many other comic books and newspaper strips. In the 70's he started working on children's TV shows and musicals, although he came back to the comic books to write three issues of Lucky Luke.
name: Lo Hartog Van Banda

deck: Writer of novels and TV series, he signs his plots in comic books as Claude Guylouis, a pseudonymn that he uses when he works with Guy Vidal and Jean-Louis Robert.
name: Claude Klotz (Patrick Cauvin)

deck: Writer of children's books and erotic novels. He is behind the pseudonymn Claude Guylouis, along with Claude Klotz and Guy Vidal.
name: Jean-Louis Robert

deck: Writer of comic books like Lucky Luke, Rantanplan and Marsupilami. Since 2002 he works in a Samurai Western called "Contes du 7eme souffle" (Tales of the 7th breath).
name: Éric Adam

description:
Gerra, Laurent (*1967)

French comic writer. For more than ten years, he worked as a humorist for the TV cabaret shows on RTL and France-2, and his gags have turned to classics by now. The album no. 77 is the first one he scetched without the creator Morris.
name: Laurent Gerra

deck: Writer of novels, essays and children's books. He was a teacher, for 25 years, before he started to write comic books.
description: Daniel Pennac was born in Casablanca in 1944 in a French military family, and was raised in Africa and South-East Asia. He eventually became a French Literature teacher in Nice, in the South of France, and began writing children's books with Cabot Caboche, published in 1982. The idea to write thrillers came to him during a trip to Brazil. His first Malaussene novel came out 1985. Since then, Pennac has become a best-selling author and French literary phenomenon.
name: Daniel Pennac

deck: Writer of novels, theatre, cinema and comic books.
name: Tonino Benacquista

deck: Writer known for Natacha, Docteur Poche and Jeanette Pointu.
name: Marc Wasterlain

deck: He started as a novelist and then moved to the comic books. He is an influential writer/penciller best remembered as a humorist.
name: Maurice Tillieux

deck: Belgian artist/writer known to be a master in the most technical drawing. He has drawn backgrounds, vehicles and buildings in Spirou et Fantasio, Gaston Lagaffe, Natacha, etc etc.
name: Jidéhem (Jean De Mesmaeker)

deck: Belgian penciller who has worked with Mittéï, Maréchal and Attanasio, creator of Les petits hommes, Aurore & Ulysse and Famille Foal.
name: Pierre Seron

deck: Belgian writer, penciller, colorist and painter. He has worked with Franquin, Goscinny, Tillieux and many others.
description: Creator of Isabelle and Monsieur Choc among others.
name: Will

deck: Penciller, creator of Lou Smog. He has worked in Fankenberg, Twins, Natacha, Une femme dans la peau, etc etc.
name: Georges Van Linthout

deck: Suzan Fox was a letterer for Marvel Comics.
description: Suzan Fox was a letterer for Marvel Comics.
name: Susan (Suzan) Fox

description:
Achdé - Hervé Darmenton (*1961)

French comic writer. began his comics career in several fanzines from 1985. He joined the publising house Dargaud in 1991. From 2003, he is the artist of the series 'Lucky Luke' and wrote the albums no. 77, 80, and the special "The French Cook".
name: Achdé

aliases:
Claudia SGC
Scarlet Gothica
Claudia SG Ianniciello
name: Claudia ScarletGothica

deck: Italian artist, a member of Nathan Never artistic staff.
name: Ivan Calcaterra

deck: Alberto Lisiero is an italian writer, known best for sci-fi comics such as Nathan Never. He's also president of Star Trek Italian Club.
name: Alberto Lisiero

deck: Gabriella Cordone is an italian writer, known for her work, together with Alberto Lisiero, in some Sci-fi comics like Nathan Never and Agenzia Alfa
name: Gabriella Cordone

deck: Writer known for his collaborations with Mitacq, Eric, William Vance, François Walthéry and, specially, René Follet.
description:
Jacques Stoquart is attracted to a career as an illustrator. He works for various advertising agencies and eventually becomes an independent copywriter in 1973. The comic book industry knocks on his door, and after many hesitations, Jacques Stoquart agrees to write "Les Galops d'enfer" (1973) for Mitacq.

Meeting Michel Greg in 1974 will however be a decisive moment in his career as a scriptwriter. He creates several new characters for the TINTIN magazine and its collaborators, such as Wen and Rorika for Eric (Frédéric Delzant), Ivan Zourine for René Follet, and Ramiro for William Vance. A similar collaboration with the competitive magazine, SPIROU, forces him to adopt the ironic pseudonym "Lemasque" for his work on Stany Derval, for Mitacq. He also writes a short Natacha story for François Walthéry under this alias (Un tour de passe-passe, 1975).

Disappointed by readers' reactions to these weeklies in the annual ratings, Stoquart withdraws and returns to advertising. At the urgent request of his friend
René Follet, he takes up scriptwriting again ten years later. The duo tries to revive Jean Valhardi and then adapt detective stories written by John Flanders, for Éditions Claude Lefrancq.

Stoquart has also written scripts for two biographies of model characters for the illustrator Cécile Schmitz ("L'Homme de Molokaï", then "Nous n'irons pas à Jérusalem" or "La vie d'Ignace de Loyola") and has adapted a novel by Isaac Asimov for Eric Loutte at Claude Lefrancq ("Les poisons de Mars").

Though he denies being a scriptwriter, he has nonetheless created a number of impressive works that will always remain classics of a comic book era.
name: Jacques Stoquart

deck: Artist known for Rahan, Capitaine Apache, Comanche, Marshall Blueberry...
description: He has worked with Andre Cheret on 'Rahan', with Norma on several episodes of 'Capitaine Apache'. with writer Rodolphe, with Patrick Cothias and with Jean Giraud (aka Moebius) in 'Marshall Blueberry'.
name: Michel Rouge

deck: Christopher Fowler is a British novelist, mostly known for his crime and horror fiction.
description:
Career

Christopher Fowler is primarily a mystery and horror fiction writer. He was the writer of Menz Insana, a graphic novel for DC with John Bolton.
name: Christopher Fowler

deck: Italian artist, he has penciled many Nathan Never stories.
name: Ernestino Michelazzo

deck: Artist who broke into the world of American comic books by providing covers for Marvel.
name: Sho Murase

description: Visconde Carlo San Juan Vergara better known as Carlo Vergara (born January 25, 1971) is a Filipino graphic designer, illustrator and writer.
name: Carlo Vergara

description: Her birth name is Alisa Zinov'yevna Rosenbaum and she died an American citizen.
name: Ayn Rand

deck: the adaption script writer to Ayn Rand's Anthem.
name: Charles Santino

deck: Richelle Mead is an fantasy writer, she currently resides in Seattle Washington.
name: Richelle Mead

deck: Inker for Image. Currently working on Samurai's Blood 6 part mini-series.
name: Matthew Dalton

deck: Dave Hamann is an artist whose work includes Amory Wars, Gauze, Grimm Fairy Tales and Dark Swan: Storm Born.
name: Dave Hamann

deck: Artist, illustrator, cartoonist, creative, art director.
description: René León was educated at the Academy of Art "Carlos Baca Flor" in his native, Arequipa, Perú. He worked for the newspapers “Expreso” and "Extra" in Lima, Peru and later traveled to Europe. He settled in Spain, where he works as a Freelance Illustrator, cartoonist, comic artist and editor. He works in various artistic fields, as an illustrator, cartoonist, colorist, comic books, graphic design, editorial, etc.
name: René León

deck: Grant Alter is a comic book and script writer who has adapted works for Dean Koontz, Richelle Mead and Jim Butcher to graphic novel.
name: Grant Alter
